Submodules#

atom.organic_scoring.organic_scoring_base module#

class atom.organic_scoring.organic_scoring_base.OrganicScoringBase(axon, synth_dataset, trigger_frequency, trigger, trigger_frequency_min=2, trigger_scaling_factor=5, organic_queue=None)[source]#

Bases: ABC

abstract async forward()[source]#

Method to establish the sampling logic for the organic scoring task. Sample data from the organic queue or the synthetic dataset (if available).

Expected to return a dictionary with information from the sampling method. If the trigger is based on seconds, the dictionary should contain the key “total_elapsed_time”.

Return type:

dict[str, Any]

increment_step()[source]#

Increment the step counter if the trigger is set to steps.

sample_rate_dynamic()[source]#

Returns dynamic sampling rate based on the size of the organic queue.

Return type:

float

set_step(step)[source]#

Set the step counter to a specific value.

Parameters:

step (int) – The step value to set.

async start_loop()[source]#

The main loop for running the organic scoring task, either based on a time interval or steps. Calls the sample method to establish the sampling logic for the organic scoring task.

async wait_until_next(timer_elapsed=0)[source]#

Wait until next iteration dynamically based on the size of the organic queue and the elapsed time.

This method implements an annealing sampling rate that adapts to the growth of the organic queue, ensuring the system can keep up with the data processing demands.

Parameters:

timer_elapsed (float) – The time elapsed during the current iteration of the processing loop. This is used to calculate the remaining sleep duration when the trigger is based on seconds.

Behavior:

  • If the trigger is set to “seconds”, the method calculates a dynamic frequency based on the current queue

size and the scaling factor, then sleeps for the remaining duration after considering the elapsed time. - If the trigger is set to “steps”, the method adjusts the step counter dynamically based on the current queue size and the scaling factor, ensuring that the system can keep up with the processing demands.

Dynamic Adjustment:

  • The dynamic_frequency is calculated by reducing the original frequency by a value proportional to the

queue size divided by the scaling factor. It ensures the frequency does not drop below min_seconds. - The dynamic_steps is calculated similarly, reducing the original step count by a value proportional to the queue size divided by the scaling factor. It ensures the steps do not drop below min_steps.

atom.organic_scoring.utils module#

atom.organic_scoring.utils.is_overridden(method)[source]#

Determine if the method is overridden in the derived class.

Parameters:

method – The method to check.

Returns:

True if the method is overridden in the derived class, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
